body: LGTM
@zjffdu title fixed.  Sorry I was in a hurry when I created it
No worries, @primerano I just notice that this Pr is for branch-0.8, do you find the same issue in master branch ?

> > Does it require zeppelin server run on localhost:8080 ? Can it work against other port ?
> 
> @zjffdu
> Yes, it can work against other port numbers.
> I have refactored the logic. Port numbers can be configured in .env file.

How to configure that ?

> > > Does it require zeppelin server run on localhost:8080 ? Can it work against other port ?
> > 
> > 
> > @zjffdu
> > Yes, it can work against other port numbers.
> > I have refactored the logic. Port numbers can be configured in .env file.
> 
> How to configure that ?

@zjffdu You can change these variables value in `zeppelin-web-vue/.env` file:

```
VUE_APP_SERVER_PORT=8080
VUE_APP_SERVER_SSL_PORT=443
VUE_APP_WEB_PORT=8081
```
Once you update the value, restart the dev server.
Maybe it makes sense to split fixes by JIRA?

@zjffdu The code seems to have been moved to ShiroAuthenticationService.java in master and it appears the same issue exists there but I have not tested it.

I have had considerable trouble building the 0.8 branch code..  the last problem was that the SAP code appears to have a java 8 library but the project requires Java 7.  

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-4341

Any hints on how to get 0.8 to build fully?   

Is master moving to Java 8?  The documentation still says it uses Java 7.
Right master use java 8. You can skip sap module via adding `-pl !sap` in maven build command

That's great! Thank you @malayhm 

My understanding VueJS completely replaces Angular in Zeppelin, and there 
will be no option to switch between the two? 
If that's the case, would be great to cut a release before committing this PR
so users will have a better baseline to compare against as this is a big change.

Thanks again!

> That's great! Thank you @malayhm
> 
> My understanding VueJS completely replaces Angular in Zeppelin, and there
> will be no option to switch between the two?
> If that's the case, would be great to cut a release before committing this PR
> so users will have a better baseline to compare against as this is a big change.
> 
> Thanks again!

You are right there is no going back once this project is finished. This PR only covers the basic UI architecture stuff, which is built in such a way that it will be super easy for future developers to contribute.

Merging this PR soon is important because this will enable me and a few other folks to start working on different features required to finish this UI revamp.

> That's great! Thank you @malayhm
> 
> My understanding VueJS completely replaces Angular in Zeppelin, and there
> will be no option to switch between the two?
> If that's the case, would be great to cut a release before committing this PR
> so users will have a better baseline to compare against as this is a big change.
> 
> Thanks again!

@Tagar There is no decision to discontinue Angular based Zeppelin Web implementation.

As of now, the plan is to have multiple Zeppelin web implementation(Angular and Vue.js), maybe as subprojects, but decision is not made by the community.

We would be supporting Angular as well as Vue.js implementation in parallel. So a user can choose based on their customization and comfort zone. There are a lot of features which may not land in the Vue.js implementation, e.g. Angular interpreter.

Created new PR https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3469. Closing this one.

Thank you @malayhm and @ieglonew01f 

IMHO it would actually be great to see VueJS to be part of mainstream Zeppelin. 
We have seen when current Zeppelin notes based on AngularJS becomes heavy after a certain 
size and users were breaking those notes into different parts for that just to render faster in browsers.
Hopefully VueJS is slimmer and gives smaller overhead for larger notes, on top of other 
improvements. Those screenshots look very cool to me. 

Thanks again for your work.

No worries 😄 and thanks for reviewing this. 
I'm merging this to master.

@Tagar Thanks for the interest of this feature. As @malayhm mentioned, it is possible we support multiple frontend for zeppelin. Each frontend implementation could be subproject of zeppelin.  And this PR is against a feature branch instead of master. 

Regarding the old angular web issue, there's another initiative of upgrading to angular 8, and POC is already done, you can try it if interested. 
https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/dfa32b35b4497df64ee9d44fc1673e9fe114675a74128fd34e06c5a2@%3Cdev.zeppelin.apache.org%3E

@zjffdu Thank you for pointing that there is a separate repo for Zeppelin with latest version of Angular - I didn't know that. Would be interesting to explore idea of a pluggable Zeppelin front-end - e.g. have one subproject for Angular, and another for Vue. So at the end we could perhaps have two official builds of Zeppelin in respective sub-projects. I don't know all the details, of course it's probably more complicated than I am thinking it is. Thanks everyone for staying on top all those exciting Zeppelin new big features.
The video also shows that the changes provided by [ZEPPELIN-3690] (#3116) are still valid :)

@zjffdu added README.md

@jongyoul:  Is there any specific reason for moving logic (initialization of classes) from the default constructor to the main method? 

The reason behind asking this is, that I am working on [ZEPPELIN-4356](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-4356), Zeppelin Server should stop when it can't create/access a notebook or if **Shiro.ini** file is not configured properly (WIP [pr-3488](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3488)).

So to achieve this I have used Immediate scope while binding the classes in ServiceLocator and successfully able to stop the Zeppelin Server, if it can't access/create a notebook & if Shiro configuration is wrong. Also, the exception is thrown when _realms are null_. Because of these changes few test-cases are failing and it throws the exception "realm is null" but it should not be null.
While debugging, I found that the **ShiroValidationService** class with **Immediate** scope is executed before the **Shiro environment gets initialized** due to multithreading, and that results in an error of "_realm was found null_" but normally it should not be null.

Also, I have checked your commits initially you have also used **Immediate** scope for **ShiroAuthenticationService**, later on, you have reverted that changes and used **Singleton** scope; is there any specific reason for that or any issue that you have observed?

Basically, I think it would be better to perform validation logic before starting the server. By doing it, you could avoid multithreading issues that you mentioned in my PR. But, what I worried about it, Shiro configuration is also pluggable in current code, thus you'd better consider the case that `shiro.ini` doesn't exist. WDYT?
And thank you for improving my code :-)

> Basically, I think it would be better to perform validation logic before starting the server. By doing it, you could avoid multithreading issues that you mentioned in my PR. But, what I worried about it, Shiro configuration is also pluggable in current code, thus you'd better consider the case that `shiro.ini` doesn't exist. WDYT?

Yes, that is what I am doing validating the configuration before starting the server. As you said Shiro configuration is also pluggable in current code so it should get initialized after Shiro Environment gets initialized?  Also is there any specific reason for moving logic (initialization of classes) from the default constructor to the main method?

great question @zjffdu , the output gets truncated when the `ZEPPELIN_INTERPRETER_OUTPUT_LIMIT` is reached.

> > Thanks for the contribution @conker84 , I am curious to know what will happen when the ksql return infinite data, will it cause frontend crash ?
> 
> great question @zjffdu , the output gets truncated when the `ZEPPELIN_INTERPRETER_OUTPUT_LIMIT` is reached.

Do you have any idea to improve it ? It is not a specific problem for ksql, but a general issue for all streaming job.
I thought we should consider the case where we don't use Shiro. That's the only reason why I moved that logic into the constructor of `SecurityService`
